page.title: 04Hillfield farm
page.content: This farm which is located in squares 05140196, 05150196 and 05140197 has been the property of the Hall family since 1907. The farm was recovered from tenants in 1982 and it now forms 50% of 300 acres farmed by Mr.Hall. The farm is situated on Heavy London clay and all but 5 acres is well drained. 66% of the acreage is sown with winter wheat, spring wheat, barley and oilseed rape; 30% is sown with grasses for hay. The latter finds a local market as some 2000 horses are kept within an 8 mile radius. Before EEC changes in 1976 Hillfield Farm stocked pigs but now a few beef cattle only are kept. The owner employs 1 full-time worker but seasonal labour is taken on for the hay and corn harvests. The density of population in the area make such farming practice as stubble burning imposssible.
